metadata.title: CVE-2024-26735 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ipv6:sr: fix possible use-after-free and null-ptr-deref The pernet operationsstructure for the subsystem must be registered before registering thegeneric netlink family.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-225.237
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-225.237
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-225.237
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1152.157
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1168.181
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1162.179
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1131.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-225.237').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1152.157').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.181').
